physical_appearance:This clipping is a page from the periodical \u0027The Orient Illustrsted Weekly\u0027 published on 10 February 1946. The title is printed at the top of the page. This page features six photographs with captions at the bottom. The edges of the page are slightly torn
 especially on the left
 with folded edges on the right.

sgcool_label_text:\Prior to the World War II period

metadata.title_text: The Orient Shah Nawaz in Netaji's Room
metadata.physical_appearance: This clipping is a page from the periodical 'The Orient Illustrsted Weekly' published on 10 February 1946. The title is printed at the top of the page. This page features six photographs with captions at the bottom. The edges of the page are slightly torn, especially on the left, with folded edges on the right.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: "Prior to the World War II period, Indians in Singapore and Malaya retained strong political, sentimental and economic ties with their home country. Anti-colonial thoughts and actions, inspired by the ""call for freedom"" in India
